Chapter 25, Part 6: The Ten Dedications
Buddha's disciple!

When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva reveals sentient beings and causes them to see the Buddha, he thus dedicates the roots of goodness, namely:
'May all sentient beings, without waiting to be exhorted, go on their own to see the Buddha, serve and make offerings to him, and all be delighted;

May all sentient beings abide in right mindfulness and always see Buddhas appearing in the world with the eye of wisdom;

May all sentient beings attain the Buddha's sovereign body and everywhere in the ten directions attain enlightenment and expound the Dharma;

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's praise of the Buddha's appearance in the world, dedicating the wholesome roots;
in order to enable sentient beings to see all Buddhas, make offerings and serve them, and ultimately purify the unsurpassed Dharma.
Buddha's disciple!

Buddha's disciple!

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give servants, they make offerings to all Buddhas, bodhisattvas, true and good spiritual friends, or give to the Sangha Jewel, or offer to their parents, the most honored and excellent field of blessings;

Moreover, they are all inspired by the pure karma of the bodhisattva, and in terms of talents, skills, crafts, and mathematics, there is none that they do not thoroughly understand, and they are well able to serve and please the mind.
At that time, the bodhisattva dedicates all wholesome roots in this way, namely:
'May all sentient beings attain a well-disciplined mind, cultivating wholesome roots in the presence of all buddhas;

May all sentient beings always delight in seeing the buddhas, never tiring of it, and not sparing their bodies and lives for the sake of the buddhas.

Buddha's disciple!

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their bodies to those who come to request, when making offerings, they give rise to a humble mind, a mind like the earth, a mind that endures suffering without changing, a mind that serves sentient beings without weariness, a mind that regards all sentient beings as if they were their kind mother, and all wholesome roots they dedicate to them. 'May all sentient beings always lack nothing in their needs, cultivate bodhisattva practices without interruption, not abandon any of the benefits of bodhisattvas, well abide in the path practiced by bodhisattvas, understand the equal nature of bodhisattvas, attain to be counted in the lineage of the TathÄgatas, abide in true speech, uphold the practices of bodhisattvas, enable the world to attain the pure Buddha Dharma, deeply believe and understand, and realize the ultimate truth of the Dharma;

May I enable all sentient beings to become the foremost in blessings and benefits, to be able to fulfill all wholesome roots;

Buddha's disciple!

May all sentient beings attain a body of Dharma power, with the great strength of forbearance that is indestructible;
May all sentient beings attain a peerless body, accomplishing the Tathagata's pure Dharma body;

This is the Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots by offering one's body to the Buddhas, in order to cause sentient beings to forever dwell in the abodes of the Buddhas of the three times.
Buddha's disciple!

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give their bodies to all sentient beings, wishing to enable them to accomplish wholesome roots and recollect wholesome roots. Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas vow that their bodies will be a great bright lamp, able to illuminate all sentient beings;

To be a bright sun, universally benefiting the world impartially.

'May all sentient beings always draw near to the Buddha and enter the Buddha's stage of knowledge;
May all sentient beings attain the wisdom of accord and abide in unsurpassed enlightenment;

May all sentient beings give rise to supreme wholesome roots and sit under the bodhi tree;

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots through giving away one's body to all sentient beings;
in order to benefit all sentient beings and enable them to attain the unsurpassed state of peace and security.
Buddha's disciple!

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the roots of goodness of serving the Buddhas;

In order to realize the enlightenment of all Buddhas, in order to save and protect all sentient beings, in order to transcend all three realms, in order to accomplish a mind free from harm, in order to attain immeasurable vast enlightenment, in order to accomplish the wisdom that illuminates the Buddha's teachings, in order to always be accepted and embraced by the Buddhas, in order to obtain the protection and support of the Buddhas, in order to believe and understand all Buddha-dharmas, in order to accomplish the roots of goodness that are equal to the Buddhas of the three times, in order to fully accomplish a mind free from regret, and in order to realize all Buddha-dharmas.
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas give away all things, including even their kingdoms and royal positions, in their acts of charity;

This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the wholesome roots of giving away the royal position;

Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas see people come to beg for the capital city, the magnificent great city, and the taxes and duties of the border guards, and they give them all without stinginess;

With vast wisdom, they understand the profound Dharma and abide in the equal Dharma-nature of the buddhas;

In order to seek omniscience, in order to deeply delight in the sovereign Dharma, in order to seek to realize sovereign wisdom, in order to purify all merits, in order to abide in firm and vast wisdom, in order to extensively gather all wholesome roots, in order to cultivate the vows of all buddha-dharmas, in order to naturally awaken to the Dharma of great wisdom, in order to abide in the bodhi-mind without retreating, in order to cultivate the vows of all bodhisattva practices and the ultimate perfection of omniscience, they practice giving.

May all sentient beings adorn and purify all worlds in the ten directions and offer them to the Buddhas.
This is the Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the roots of goodness from giving away the royal capital, in order to enable sentient beings to adorn and purify all Buddha-lands.

At that time, the bodhisattva observes the roots of goodness, dedicating them in order to cause all sentient beings to attain liberation, dedicating them in order to attain the joy of the Buddha's teachings, dedicating them in order to attain firmness within the unfirm, dedicating them in order to attain the indestructible mind of vajra wisdom, dedicating them in order to enter the Buddha's site of enlightenment, dedicating them in order to reach the other shore, dedicating them in order to attain the unsurpassed bodhi mind, dedicating them in order to comprehend all dharmas with wisdom, dedicating them in order to give rise to all roots of goodness, dedicating them in order to enter the families of the buddhas of the three times.
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas abide in such dharmas, born in the TathÄgata family;
Increasing the pure and supreme causes of the buddhas, giving rise to the supreme path of omniscience;
Deeply entering the vast wisdom-karma of bodhisattvas, eliminating all worldly afflictions and distress, always able to offer meritorious fields of blessings;
For all beings, expounding the wonderful Dharma, skillfully establishing them, causing them to cultivate pure practices, always diligently embracing all roots of goodness.
At that time, the bodhisattva dedicates all roots of goodness in this way, namely:
'May all sentient beings always attain immeasurable samÄdhi retinues, the supreme samÄdhi of bodhisattvas continuing uninterrupted;
May all sentient beings always delight in seeing the Buddha, entering all the buddhas' adorned samÄdhis;
May all sentient beings accomplish the inconceivable samÄdhi of bodhisattvas, freely playing with immeasurable spiritual powers;
May all sentient beings enter the samÄdhi of suchness, attaining an indestructible mind;
May all sentient beings attain the bodhisattvas' profound samÄdhi and gain mastery over all meditative absorptions.
May all sentient beings attain the mind of liberation and accomplish all the retinue of samÄdhis.
May all sentient beings become skilled in various samÄdhis and be able to gather in the characteristics of all samÄdhis.
May all sentient beings attain the samÄdhi of supreme wisdom and be able to study all the approaches to samÄdhi.
May all sentient beings attain the unobstructed samÄdhi and enter deep meditative absorption without ever regressing.
May all sentient beings attain the unattached samÄdhi and always abide in right concentration without grasping at dualistic dharmas.
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of wholesome roots when giving away all the inner palace retinue;
in order to cause all sentient beings to attain an indestructible and pure retinue;
in order to cause all sentient beings to attain a bodhisattva retinue;
in order to enable all sentient beings to attain complete satisfaction in the Buddha's teachings;ğŸ”½in order to enable all sentient beings to fulfill the power of omniscience;
in order to enable all sentient beings to realize unsurpassed wisdom;ğŸ”½in order to enable all sentient beings to obtain harmonious retinues;
in order to enable all sentient beings to dwell together with companions who practice the same way;
in order to enable all sentient beings to be endowed with all blessings and wisdom;ğŸ”½in order to enable all sentient beings to accomplish pure roots of goodness;
in order to enable all sentient beings to obtain a well-harmonious retinue;
in order to enable all sentient beings to accomplish the TathÄgata's pure Dharma body;
in order to enable all sentient beings to accomplish the eloquence of gradual, logical explanations, and to skillfully expound the inexhaustible Dharma treasury of the buddhas;
in order to enable all sentient beings to forever abandon all worldly roots of goodness, and to cultivate together the pure roots of goodness that transcend the world;
In order to enable all sentient beings to perfect their pure karma and accomplish all pure dharmas;
In order to enable all sentient beings to manifest all Buddha-dharmas and adorn and purify them with the light of the Dharma.
Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas are able to give away their beloved wives and children, just like the past Prince SudÄna, the present King of Adornments Bodhisattva, and the other innumerable bodhisattvas.
At that time, the bodhisattva rides the mind of omniscience, practices all giving, and purifies the bodhisattva's path of giving.

He enables sentient beings to purify their profound aspirations, accomplish the practices of enlightenment, contemplate the bodhisattva path, think of the Buddha's enlightenment, and abide in the Buddha's lineage.
Having accomplished such a mind of giving, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is determined to seek the TathÄgata's body;
They contemplate their own bodies, which are connected to everything and lack independence;

Bodhisattvas thus think of sentient beings and wish to make their own bodies the foremost stupa, causing everyone to give rise to joy;

Buddha's disciple!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, with a liberated mind free from bondage or attachment, give away their wives and children, gathering wholesome roots in this way and directing their vows accordingly, namely:
'May all sentient beings abide in the Buddha's enlightenment, give rise to transformed bodies, pervade the Dharma realm, and turn the irreversible wheel;
May all sentient beings attain an unattached body, and by the power of their vows travel to all buddha-lands;
May all sentient beings abandon the mind of love and hatred, and sever the bonds of greed and anger;
May all sentient beings become the Buddha's disciples and follow the Buddha's practices;
May all sentient beings give rise to their own indestructible minds towards the buddhas;
May all sentient beings always become the Buddha's disciples, born through the transformation of the Dharma;
May all sentient beings attain the ultimate state and accomplish the TathÄgata's sovereign wisdom;
May all sentient beings realize the Buddha's enlightenment and forever leave behind afflictions;
May all sentient beings be able to expound the Buddha's enlightenment, and always enjoy practicing the unsurpassed Dharma giving;
May all sentient beings attain right concentration, and not be destroyed by any conditions;
May all sentient beings sit under the bodhi tree, attain perfect enlightenment, and reveal countless good men and women born from the Dharma.

' This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the wholesome roots of giving away one's wife and children, in order to enable all sentient beings to attain unobstructed liberation and non-attached wisdom.
Buddha's disciple!

He is not attached to his home, and is free from all thoughts and contemplations related to living at home. He detests the activities and necessities of making a living, is not greedy or indulgent, and has no attachment in his mind;
He knows that living at home is easily destroyed, and his mind always abhors and abandons it, without any fondness for it at all;
I only wish to leave the household life and cultivate bodhisattva practices, adorning myself with the teachings of the buddhas;
I will give up everything, without any regret in my heart, and will always be praised by the buddhas;
Houses and wealth, whatever I have, I will give to others, without any attachment in my mind;
When I see those who come to beg, I will be filled with joy.
At that time, the bodhisattva dedicates these roots of goodness in the following way:
'May all sentient beings abandon wives and children and accomplish the supreme bliss of leaving the household life;
May all sentient beings liberate themselves from the bondage of the household life and enter the non-household life, practicing pure conduct within the teachings of the buddhas;
May all sentient beings abandon the defilement of stinginess and delight in giving everything, without any regression in their minds;
May all sentient beings forever leave behind the ways of the household life, with few desires and contentment, accumulating nothing;
May all sentient beings leave behind worldly households and abide in the household of the tathÄgatas;
May all sentient beings attain unobstructed Dharma and eliminate all obstructed paths;
May all sentient beings be free from attachment to family and relatives, and although appearing in a home, have no attachments in their minds;
May all sentient beings be able to skillfully guide and teach, not leaving the family Dharma, and expound the wisdom of the Buddha;
May all sentient beings, with their bodies present in the home, always accord with the Buddha's wisdom and abide in it;
May all sentient beings, on the ground of living in a home, abide in the Buddha's ground, and cause immeasurable and boundless sentient beings to give rise to a joyful mind.'

Buddha's disciple!
When the Bodhisattva-mahÄsattva is practicing such wholesome roots, he does not become weary of evil sentient beings, nor does he mistakenly give rise to the thought of abandoning them.

Even if all sentient beings in the world were ungrateful, the bodhisattva would not have the slightest resentment towards them, not giving rise to a single thought of seeking to repay them in return, but only wishing to extinguish their immeasurable suffering and distress;
In the world, the mind is like empty space, unattached, universally observing the true characteristics of all dharmas;
Giving rise to great vows to extinguish the suffering of sentient beings, never abandoning the aspiration for the Great Vehicle;
Extinguishing all views, cultivating the equal practices and vows of the bodhisattvas.
Buddha's disciple!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, having observed in this way, gathers all wholesome roots and dedicates them all, namely:
'May all sentient beings moment by moment give rise to immeasurable wholesome dharmas and accomplish the unsurpassed mind of a garden and grove;
May all sentient beings attain the immovable Dharma and see all buddhas, causing them all to rejoice;
May all sentient beings delight in the garden of the Dharma and attain the wonderful bliss of the gardens and groves of all buddha-lands;
May all sentient beings attain a pure and wondrous mind and always see the TathÄgata's grove of spiritual powers;
May all sentient beings attain the play and joy of the Buddha and always skillfully enjoy playing in the realm of wisdom;
May all sentient beings attain the joy of play and go to the assemblies at the sites of enlightenment in all buddha-realms;
May all sentient beings accomplish the liberation and play of bodhisattvas and practice the bodhisattva conduct for future kalpas without wearying;
May all sentient beings see all buddhas filling the Dharma realm, give rise to an expansive mind, and dwell in the Buddha's grove;
May all sentient beings be able to go to all buddha-realms and make offerings to the buddhas in each realm;
May all sentient beings attain a wholesome and desirous mind and adorn all buddha-realms with purity.'
This is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's dedication of the wholesome roots of giving all parks, groves, and terraces.
In order to enable sentient beings to see all Buddhas and play in all Buddha gardens and forests.
Buddha's disciple!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattva gives all the necessities of life, with a mind free from stinginess, not seeking rewards;

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas dedicate the roots of goodness in this way, their physical, verbal, and mental actions are all liberated, unattached, and unfettered. In this way, it is not a bound dedication, not a dedication of what is bound and unbound;
it is not a dedication of karma, not a dedication of the results of karma;
Not a dedication with discrimination, not a dedication without discrimination;ğŸ”½Not a dedication with thought, not a dedication after thought;

When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva dedicates in this way, he does not cling to the internal, does not cling to the external;
Does not cling to the object of cognition, does not cling to the subject of cognition;
Does not cling to causes, does not cling to effects;
Does not cling to dharmas, does not cling to non-dharmas;
Does not cling to thought, does not cling to non-thought;
Does not cling to form, does not cling to the arising of form, does not cling to the cessation of form;

Does not cling to feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, does not cling to the arising of feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, does not cling to the cessation of feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.
Buddha's disciple!
If the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva can not cling to these dharmas, then he does not bind form, does not bind the arising of form, does not bind the cessation of form;
They are not bound to feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, nor are they bound to the arising or cessation of feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.
If one is not bound to these dharmas, then one is also not liberated from dharmas.
Why is this?
There are no dharmas that arise in the present, have arisen, or will arise;

All dharmas have their own characteristics in this way, without intrinsic nature, separated from intrinsic nature, neither one nor two, neither many nor immeasurable, neither small nor large, neither narrow nor broad, neither deep nor shallow, neither tranquil nor discursive, neither a place nor not a place, neither dharma nor non-dharma, neither substance nor non-substance, neither existent nor non-existent.
When bodhisattvas contemplate dharmas in this way, they are not dharmas;
In language, following worldly conventions, what is not Dharma is taken as Dharma;
Not cutting off the paths of action, not abandoning the practices of enlightening beings, seeking omniscience without ever turning back;
Knowing all karmic conditions are like dreams, sounds are like echoes, beings are like shadows, and phenomena are like illusions, yet not destroying the power of causes and conditions;
Knowing that all karmic activities have a vast function, understanding that all phenomena are without action, practicing the path of non-action without ever neglecting it.
Buddha's disciple!
This enlightening being, abiding in omniscience, whether in a proper place or not, universally dedicates to the nature of omniscience;
In all places, he dedicates without turning back.

Buddha's disciple!
This is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's sixth dedication, following and solidifying all wholesome roots.

Fully in accordance with firm dharmas, indestructible by any vajra, attaining mastery over all dharmas.

At that time, Vajra Banner Bodhisattva, observing the ten directions, observing the assembly, and observing the Dharma realm, entered the profound meaning of the words and phrases, cultivated immeasurable vast thoughts, with a great compassionate mind universally covering the world, prolonging the lineage of Buddhas of the past, present, and future, entering the merits and virtues of all Buddhas, accomplishing the body of mastery over the power of all Buddhas, observing the delights in the minds of sentient beings, according to the wholesome roots that can be matured, manifesting a form body based on the Dharma-nature body, and with the Buddha's spiritual power he spoke in verse:
Bodhisattvas manifest a body as a king, unsurpassed in worldly status,
Their merit and majestic radiance surpass all, universally benefiting the multitude of beings.
Their minds are pure and unstained, revered by all with worldly authority,
Proclaiming the true Dharma to instruct others, universally enabling sentient beings to attain peace and security.
Born in a noble family, ascending to the throne, always relying on the right teachings to turn the wheel of Dharma,
By nature benevolent and compassionate, without cruelty or oppression, revered and transformed by all in the ten directions.
Wisdom and discernment are always clear, with perfect physical appearance and talents,
Governing the land, all submit, crushing and subduing the armies of demons, leaving none remaining.
Upholding pure precepts without transgression, resolutely enduring without wavering,

Food, drink, incense, garlands, clothing, vehicles, bedding, seats, and lamps,
Bodhisattvas give to people all of these, and also countless other kinds.
They practice giving for the sake of benefiting others, causing them to develop a vast mind,

They may give their head, or give their eyes, or give their hands, or give their feet,

Bodhisattvas dwell in the great king's position, with a noble and wealthy lineage, honored among people,
Opening their mouth, they extend their tongue to give to the masses, their mind joyful, without worry or longing.

Either giving away one's wife, children, and royal position, or giving one's body to be a servant,
The mind is pure and always joyful, and in this way there is no worry or regret about anything.

For the sake of hearing the Dharma, one gives away one's body, cultivates ascetic practices, and seeks enlightenment,
